Subject: [junit] Doubt!


Hi all,

IÂ´m trying to learn about JUNIT. I have created a test class and I run it. I
defined a method called "testSoma". It has to returns an error, because it
tests if "2+2=4", but I coded to compare with "5", not to "4". When I run
the JUNIT test, it not returns any error. Do I did something wrong?

My Class:


package com.teste;

import java.math.BigDecimal;

import junit.framework.TestCase;

/**

* @author Rafael Lopes

*

* 11/03/2004

*/

public class MatematicaTest extends TestCase {

private Matematica mat;

private int somaInt;

private int subInt;

private int multInt;

private int divInt;



/**

* Constructor for MatematicaTest.

* @param arg0

*/

public MatematicaTest(String arg0) {

super(arg0);

}

public void testSoma() {

assertTrue((new BigDecimal(somaInt)).compareTo(mat.soma(new
BigDecimal(2),new BigDecimal(2)))==0);

}

public void testSubtrai() {

assertTrue((new BigDecimal(subInt)).compareTo(mat.subtrai(new
BigDecimal(5),new BigDecimal(2)))==0);

}

public void testMultiplica() {

assertTrue((new BigDecimal(multInt)).compareTo(mat.multiplica(new
BigDecimal(3),new BigDecimal(2)))==0);

}

public void testDividir() {

assertTrue((new BigDecimal(divInt)).compareTo(mat.dividir(new
BigDecimal(10),new BigDecimal(2)))==0);

}



//Override Methods - setUp();tearDown();runTest()

protected void setUp() throws Exception {

mat = new Matematica();

somaInt = 3;

subInt = 3;

multInt = 6;

divInt = 5;

}

protected void tearDown() throws Exception {

mat = null;

}



protected void runTest() throws Throwable {

new MatematicaTest("testSoma");

new MatematicaTest("testSubtrai");

new MatematicaTest("testMultiplica");

new MatematicaTest("testDividir");

}

}
